ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Assignments to complete outside of class lecture time.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I developed basic conversation skills on most topics as well as listening, reading, and writing skills. I also learned a basic amount about Brazilian culture.
I was able to develop basic conversational Portuguese skills by taking this course, far more than I had expected to attain in just one semester.

I quickly learned to speak Portuguese at an elementary level. While much of this has to do with my Spanish-speaking origin, I feel like I could handle a week or so in a major Portuguese-speaking city with my current skills.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Could focus on grammar a bit more but overall very enjoyable.

I think the time in which the course is offered was quite early especially for students in different time zones. I would change the course time to a later time. We had very productive classes where we completed exercises and conversed with one another. However, I would have preferred that we receive some more consistent homework, which could even be watching episodes of a show in Portuguese. I think, as a class, this would have made us progress faster.

The strengths of this course were the relaxed and accommodating nature of how the course was taught. The professor always allowed students to take extra time if needed for an assignment while keeping everyone learning well. One drawback was the experiential learning credits hours, as they were limited.
Very fun and engaging seminars. Lots of interesting opportunities to interact with TAs and professor outside of class that were helpful as well.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Again, I would change the time of the course because it was very early. I did appreciate the flexibility of our exams and I felt that this took away a lot of pressure and helped me take my time during exams.
The course allowed for the students to accomplish tasks and assignments on their own time with plenty of leeway.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to begin Portuguese or find out if they're interested in proceeding with this language. I encourage Spanish speakers to not be afraid to use their Spanish as a tool in this. Rafael is very kind, patient, and overall a great teacher who created a low-stakes environment for us to learn.
Yes absolutely. I felt I learned much more than i had initially expected to and am very satisfied with my experience.

Yes! Portuguese is a beautiful language and learning about the countries in which it is spoken is always fun and enriching. Not at all what I expected from a college language course bc I was actually able to learn from experience
and not memorization!

Definitely. Portuguese is a relatively easy and useful second language for English-speakers and especially for other Romance-language speakers, granting access to nearly 300 million speakers and workplace advantages in Brazil, Portugal, and significant parts of Africa.
